Product Details: {'Content advisory': ['Violence', 'foul language'], 'Audio languages': ['English'], 'Subtitles': ['English (US) [CC]', 'English [CC]'], 'Directors': ['Peter Hyams'], 'Producers': ['Sam Mercer', 'Gale Anne Hurd'], 'Starring': ['Penelope Ann Miller', 'Tom Sizemore', 'Linda Hunt']}
Review Text: Having LOVED every book these two have written, especially this one, I couldn't wait to see the movie.  I don't mind so much that it veered from the book  and left out Pendergast, but the whole movie is shot in very low light, which annoys me.  It just didn't build the suspense or keep you in that glorious place where you are afraid to look/afraid to look away.
Review Title: Where's Pendergast?
Rating: 3.0
--------------------------------------------------

Review Date: 2013/10/11
Average Rating: 4.7
Product Details: {'Content advisory': ['Violence', 'alcohol use', 'foul language', 'sexual content'], 'Audio languages': ['English', 'English [Audio Description]'], 'Subtitles': ['English [CC]'], 'Directors': ['Norberto Barba', "Terrence O'Hara", 'Eric Laneuville', 'Aaron Lipstadt', 'Peter Werner', 'David Solomon', 'Steven DePaul', 'John Behring', 'Darnell Martin', 'Karen Gaviola'], 'Starring': ['David Giuntoli', 'Bitsie Tulloch', 'Russell Hornsby']}
Review Text: I LOVE this show.  The good guys are actually good without being feeble.  The bad guys are really bad.  There is action and suspense but lots of compassion, kindness, and morality and, like all good fairy tales......everyone gets what's coming to them in the end --- even the good guys.
Review Title: Grimm not so grim
Rating: 5.0

Review Text: I loved this series because I like the characters.  They made me care.  Now that I've reached the end, I will miss their wit, their courage, their compassion, and their adventures.  Left me wanting another season!
Review Title: Wish there were more!

raw_response:
SUMMARY:
The analyzed purchase history reveals a strong preference for narrative depth, character development, and moral complexity, particularly in genres combining elements of suspense, action, and fantasy. High ratings consistently highlight admiration for compelling storytelling, emotional engagement, and well-crafted characters, as seen in the 4.5 to 5.0 ratings for various shows and movies. 

Common themes include a fondness for narratives where good versus evil is clearly delineated. The reviewer's aversion to low-light visuals suggests a need for clarity in storytelling, favoring well-lit scenes that enhance suspense. The individual's responses indicate a low tolerance for mediocrity, as demonstrated by a significant drop in satisfaction with a poorly executed adaptation.

Quality preferences revolve around engaging narratives, strong character arcs, and high production values. The reviewer shows an inclination towards thoughtful content with moral undertones, as evidenced by their appreciation for shows that balance action with compassion. 

Price sensitivity is subtle and not overtly evident, suggesting a willingness to invest in quality entertainment despite minor variations in price. This individual looks for meaningful content that evokes emotions and creates a connection with characters, indicating a preference for curated, high-quality viewing experiences over casual entertainment.

target_interaction.title: Where's Season 3 - 10?
target_interaction.text: These are people you enjoy spending time with again and again.  Their courage and support of one another and great moral dilemmas all add depth to a lot of excitement and entertainment.  These writers need to come up with a way for the show to go on! I hated watching the last episode knowing there weren't any more.
description: Season 2 picks up eight months after last year's finale with the stage set for an explosive turn of events at the Binghamton facility (the Guantanamo of the Alpha world) that could have devastating, far-reaching consequences. Dr. Lee Rosen (Emmy Award-winner and Academy Award-nominee David Strathairn), having exposed the existence of Alphas to the unsuspecting public, finds himself discredited and imprisoned by a government desperate to cover up his revelation. The rest of the core team has disbanded and some, without Rosen's guidance and care, have regressed to their old, destructive ways. They must now battle their individual demons in order to reunite and try to save their own.
target_interaction.subtitle: UnentitledUnentitled
